subject: Hello,
body:
Hello,
My email is  about a business proposal we can both be involved in
together.  Reply for further details please.
Mr Peter Wong

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Mr. Peter Wong,

I'm intrigued by your proposal and would love to hear more about it. Could you please provide some more details? What kind of business are we talking about here?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Ezra

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Greetings from Hong Kong, I hope my email reaches you in good health. This
is to acknowledge receipt of your email, and the content of your email was
well understood. I apologise for the unsolicited letter I sent to you, but
it was as a result of the prevailing circumstances and urgency surrounding
this inheritance claim that I decided to reach you that way.   I must
express my profound gratitude to you for finding the time to respond to my
letter.

I want to use this great opportunity to assure you that, as far as I am
concerned, this claims process is 100% risk-free on your side, and if you
cooperate fully with me by adhering to my instructions and advice, there
would be no hindrance in the execution of this transaction. Inclusively,our
dealings must be kept 100% confidential from both ends because of my
position in the deal. I guarantee that all modalities will be put in place
to secure all legal backup documents that will register you legally as the
legitimate next of kin to the late client.

The Hong Kong government has established an Independent Commission on
Dormant Assets to confiscate all unclaimed funds and dormant accounts. The
commission has uncovered 2 billion United States dollars in unclaimed
assets across a variety of financial services, including insurance
products, stocks and shares, and pensions. The board of directors of our
bank has now adopted a resolution that if the next of kin of our deceased
customer does not show up for the payment of this money, the money will be
declared an abandoned fund and be forwarded to the Hong Kong government
coffers as unclaimed funds. Our bank has planned to confiscate the funds
after the expiration of the period given to me.

Essentially,your assistance is required to fit you in as the next of kin to
my late client The fact that your last name matches that of our deceased
client makes you eligible to stand for claims as his next of kin or
beneficiary. Please note that at this present time, you are the only person
I have contacted, and I started this research recently because the due date
given to apply for claims is fast approaching. As a professional banker
with many years of banking experience, the required instruments to bring
this inheritance claim to fruition in adherence to all international
monetary laws are at my disposal.

Your role is to be presented as the next of kin to the deceased funds, and
as the credit and investment director, I will provide the evidence to
attest to this. I strongly believe we can conclude this transaction within
21 banking days.

How to Proceed:

Firstly, we must require the services of a reputable financial attorney
here in Hong Kong, whom I will appoint as your legal representative and who
is an expert in probate-related matters. The Attorney will procure all
legal backup documents (Affidavit of Oath and Letter of Probate Without
Will) in the High Court here in Hong Kong that will register your name as
the next of kin to my late client. The appropriate legal backup documents
will empower you, the next of kin, to claim the deceased funds as his legal
next of kin. All processes will be perfectly executed in a proper and legal
manner, and when all necessary documentation for the fund's release is met
and satisfied, approval will be given by the board of our bank for the
fundâ€™s release to you as the next of kin and beneficiary.

The above is a very concise explanation of the entire process of this
transaction. This process will only take a few banking days to complete. As
soon as I receive your response, I will provide you with the full
information of my late client.

As a consequence of the funds involved and my identity, please kindly keep
our relationship completely surreptitious until the successful conclusion
of this deal. You must note that the bank management is not aware of my
communication with you in regards to the inheritance claim, and as such,
strict confidentiality must be adhered to at all times until we have
succeeded.


Before his demise, he deposited the sum of US$69,850,000.00 (Sixty Nine
Million, Eight Hundred And Fifty Thousand, United States Dollars) placed
under the management of our bank. The institution, being aware of his
death, has mandated me to present a member of his family (heir/inheritor)
or Next of Kin to make claims of his funds with our bank. Otherwise, it
will be confiscated by the authorities and revert back to the treasury of
the Hong Kong Government as unclaimed. This action is in conformity with
Hong Kong Financial Laws which stipulates that such unclaimed monies become
the property of the government in the advent of the unavailability of a
next of kin to lay claims to the estate within a specified time frame.
However, this law is unjust and inhuman as it often creates an avenue for
the top officials of financial institutions to divert such fortunes for
their selfish use.


Yours faithfully, and please kindly reply soon.

Your Faithfully,,

Mr.Peter Wong
